column5: Borrowed from another board:  http://gcaptain.com/drowning/?10981 Well worth a look.
Interesting.  Thank you for posting that.
Good find. I think many of us take our, and others, safety on the water far to lightly.
A real eye opener Albert. Thanks

Very good article. I was a lifeguard for about 5 years and pulled several people from the water. Lots of times the children were close enough to the wall to grab on but never even tried. Worst situations were when parents tried to catch kids at the bottom of the slide or when jumping in. If the child panics and starts pulling down the parent it gets ugly. Called the double clutch. There are stories of people biting fingers off of the the other person becaus they get their hands in the mouth and push down. If you can't swim well then stay where you can touch.
Very good article! Something we should all know.
Very good info Home Town, thanks for posting.
very good article thanks for posting , I am forwarding that to friends and family
Wow...that is a real sobering article.  Anyone going near the water needs to understand that.  Great post, HTHM
Good stuff Albert. Thanks for posting it.
Yep, great info. pass that on via facebook and email.
